document.docOrigin: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 160 (2)
document.docTitle: Gammarus hypolithicus Hou & Li 2010, SP. NOV.
document.masterDocTitle: Intraspecific or interspecific variation: delimitation of species boundaries within the genus Gammarus (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Gammaridae), with description of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Intraspecific or interspecific variation: delimitation of species boundaries within the genus Gammarus (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Gammaridae), with description of four new species
Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

subSubSection.paragraph:
Synonymy:
Gammarus sp3
Hou et al. , 2007: 599
.

Material examined:
Holotype (IZCAS-I-A317), male, Baishishan Mt. ( 39°12′N , 114°36′E ), altitude
2096 m
, Laiyuan County , Hebei Province , collected by Z. Hou and Y. Lin ,
5.ix.2004
.
Paratypes (from IZCAS-I- A317-2 to IZCAS-I-A317-24): 15 males , eight females , same locality with holotype
.
Etymology: The epithet of the species name is from the habitat, where the new species was found under stone.

Diagnosis: Pereopods 3 and 4 with long setae on posterior margins; pereopods 5–7 slender; epimeral plates 1–3 subacute in posterodistal corners; urosomites 1–3 flat; inner ramus of uropod 3 about 0.6 times the length of outer ramus, both rami of uropod 3 with plumose setae; telson with basolateral spines and long setae.
Body length: 12.3 mm .

Antenna 1 ( Fig. 14B ): peduncular articles 1–3 in length ratio 1: 0.7: 0.4, with short lateral and distal setae; flagellum with 30 articles, aesthetascs present from article 4–26; accessory flagellum with five articles; both primary and accessory flagella with short distal setae.
Pereopods 5–7 slender.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 14.
Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov.
, male. A, head; B, antenna 1; C, antenna 2; D, upper lip; E, left mandible; F, incisor of right mandible; G, lower lip; H, left maxilla 1; I, palp of right maxilla 1; J, maxilla 2; K, maxilliped; L, dactylus of palp of maxilliped.

Figure 15.
Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov.
, male. A, gnathopod 1; B, gnathopod 2; C, propodus of gnathopod 1; D, propodus of gnathopod 2; E, epimeral plate 1; F, epimeral plate 2; G, epimeral plate 3; H, telson.

Figure 16.
Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov.
, male. A, pereopod 3; B, pereopod 4; C, pereopod 5; D, pereopod 6; E, pereopod 7; F, dactylus of pereopod 3; G, dactylus of pereopod 4; H, dactylus of pereopod 5; I, dactylus of pereopod 6; J, dactylus of pereopod 7.

Figure 17.
Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov.
, male, A–G; female, H, I. A, pleopod 1; B, pleopod 2; C, pleopod 3; D, uropod 1; E, uropod 2; F, uropod 3; G, urosomites 1–3; H, uropod 3, I, telson.

Figure 18.
Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov.
, female. A, gnathopod 1; B, gnathopod 2; C, propodus of gnathopod 1; D, propodus of gnathopod 2; E, oostegite of gnathopod 2; F, oostegite of pereopod 3; G, oostegite of pereopod 4; H, oostegite of pereopod 5.

subSubSection.paragraph: Coxal gills: coxal gill of gnathopod 2 and gills of pereopods 3–5 a little shorter than bases; gill of pereopod 6 about half length of basis; gill of pereopod 7 smallest, less than half of basis.
Body length: 10.3 mm .
Pereopods 3 and 4 with straight setae on posterior margin.

Habitat: Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov. was only found in the type locality, a small pool near the peak of
Baishishan Mt.
This
pool was less than
1 m
2 , and water fell from a height of
10 m .

Remarks: Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov. differs from
G . nekkensis
(state in parentheses) in long straight setae on posterior margin of pereopods 3 and 4 (curled setae), both margins of rami of uropod 3 with plumose setae (outer margin of outer ramus with simple setae).
Gammarus hypolithicus
sp. nov. is distinguished from
G . clarus
(state in parentheses) by epimeral plate 3 with small acute tooth (acute); urosomites 1–2 flat, with four groups of spines and setae on dorsal margin (elevated, with three groups of spines and setae on dorsal margin); telson with long setae (short setae).
